intro: Bhesa andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman mountain apple, is a small evergreen tree native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits that are edible. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
